result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Wesley R Vomastic was found guilty of OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wesley R Vomastic

records.addlTxt: 10:58 AM Attorney Sarvan Singh in court.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties via zoom.  Motion to grant IID time credit.  Atty Singh heard on motion date 5-24-17 to 9-23-2019 credit for time when IID was installed and find IID completed and request Amended Conviction Status Report. State objects to any credit time be given and quotes statue and is when valid license was granted once IID will start. Atty Singh heard on date of issue of license, however, def. had different sentence. Atty Singh continues argument.  Rebuttal by State.  Court advised Atty Singh to file a proposed revised order and Judge will make a decision within a week.  Atty Singh gives argument. Parties may submit cases if would like. Court adjourns @ 11:13 am.
Motion hearing on May 19, 2021 at 11:00 am.
Per Judge - Waiting for stipulation from DA or hearing. May be re-submitted based on outcome of either of the above
for time credited for ignition interlock device
of Wesley R. Vomastic
In support of IID Credit (Referred to Judge)

records.addlTxt: DNA Proof of Submission

Court calls  @ 2:08 pm.  Attorney Sarvan Singh in court.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court ordered no electronic monitoring.  Atty Singh heard on electronic monitoring order either silent on JOC or allow electronic monitoring.  Atty Singh talked to Portage County and def. will seat however will not accept because on JOC. Atty Singh would like language removed from JOC. State heard on request and doesn't object.  Atty Singh replys. Court orders amend JOC to remove the language no electronic monitoring.
DNA Order and Acknowledgement

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Defendant Wesley R Vomastic in court with attorney Sarvan Singh.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CM250, 15TR955, 15TR919 @ 2:17 p.m. DA Constable authorized to appear on the city citations. State gives agreement - will be filing amended complaint for misd 4th offense, dri ct 2. 60 days jail, may transfer, $2009 fine and costs, 26 month revocation, IID, AODA and driver safety plan. Ct 3 dismiss and consolidate, dismiss 15TR955 and 15TR919. Atty Singh and Def agree. Court grants motion to amend ct 1 to OWI 4th as misd. Plea quest. reviewed. Plea to ct 1 as amended - no contest. Court grants motion to dri ct 2 and dismiss and consolidate ct 3, dismiss outright 15TR919 and 15TR955. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Singh satisfied. Court finds Def understands and plea freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts plea and finds guilty of OWI 4th. State asks Court to adopt agreement. Remarks by Atty Singh. Nothing by Defendant. Remarks by the Court. BAC .134. Court will follow agreement. 60 days jail, may serve in another county, commence today, huber, report by 7 p.m. Credit for 1 day served. Jail may not be electronic monitoring. $2009 fine and costs, including DNA surcharge. DNA sample. 26 month revocation, retroactive to any admin. susp.  IID 26 months. AODA and driver safety plan. Postconviction rights. Apply bond, pay balance today.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 24, 2017 at 01:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 1, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Motion hearing on January 31, 2017 at 02:15 pm.
State's

Final pre-trial on October 24, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Jury trial on November 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.
No use of alcohol.  No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Defendant Wesley R Vomastic in court with attorney Sarvan Singh by telephone.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 9:04 am. Atty Singh has copy of amended complaint, enters Not Guilty pleas. Court receives not guilty plea & direct COC to enter. Atty Singh can appear by telephone for Status.  Def. does not have to appear for Status.  State gives bond recommendations. Court orders $1900.00 cash bond, already posted w/conditions. 15TR919 & 15TR955 Def. received citations. Not Guilty plea to both citations.  Court receives pleas.  Status conference scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
